rich.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: someone who is rich has a lot of money and valuable possessions
rich.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: one of the richest women in America
She found herself a rich husband.
He thought this was the easiest way to get rich.
the rich nations of the world
His brother’s stinking rich (=very rich, in a way that you do not approve of).
She was both beautiful and fabulously rich.
rich.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: houses belonging to the rich and famous
rich.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: Rich mineral deposits have been found in the sea bed.
Red meat is a rich source of iron.
Pregnant women should eat protein-rich foods.
Citrus fruits are rich in vitamin C.
rich.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: full of interesting or important facts, events, or ideas
rich.translation[0].definitions[3].examp: the rich literary tradition of England
The area has a very rich history.
a story that was rich in detail
rich.translation[0].definitions[4].defin: rich food contains a lot of butter, cream, or eggs, which make you feel full very quickly
rich.translation[0].definitions[5].defin: a rich smell or flavour is strong and pleasant
rich.translation[0].definitions[5].examp: the rich scent of the pine trees
meat with a wonderfully rich flavour
rich.translation[0].definitions[6].defin: a rich colour is strong and attractive
rich.translation[0].definitions[7].defin: a rich sound is low and pleasant
rich.translation[0].definitions[7].examp: the rich tone of a cello
He laughed with a rich, throaty chuckle.
rich.translation[0].definitions[8].defin: rich soil is good for growing plants in
rich.translation[0].definitions[8].examp: Vegetables grow well in the rich, black soil.
rich.translation[0].definitions[9].defin: rich cloth is expensive and beautiful
rich.translation[0].definitions[9].examp: She stroked the rich velvet of the dress enviously.
rich.translation[0].note_box[0].sections: He is a very rich man.
He came from an extremely rich Viennese family.
He was immensely rich and owned two yachts.
She must have been fabulously rich to live in a house like this.
They stand to become seriously rich if the venture succeeds.
They just wanted to get rich.
Over the years, he became enormously rich.
They have grown rich by selling this technology to other companies.
The trade in tea made the British rich.
For Russia's new rich, life is a candy store.
rich.translation[0].note_box[1].sections: rich
having a lot of money – used about people and places
She married a rich Greek shipowner.
one of the world’s richest nations
wealthy
rich – used about people and places, especially when they have been rich for a long time
wealthy landowners
Orange County is a very wealthy area.
a wealthy Arab businessman
affluent
rich – used about societies, groups of people, or areas where people live, where people have nice houses and a lot of expensive possessions
today’s affluent society
affluent young professionals
an affluent suburb of Boston
prosperous
rich – used about places and groups of people, especially when their money is related to success in business
Sales have grown fastest in the more prosperous areas of the south.
prosperous merchants and bankers
well-off
fairly rich compared to other people, so that you can live very comfortably
Her parents are pretty well-off.
children from well-off families
well-to-do
rich – used especially in the past about families and people who had a fairly high position in society
Only well-to-do families could afford to send their children to university.
The Westons were now well-to-do and there was no necessity for work.
privileged
having special advantages because your family have a lot of money and a high position in society
He comes from a privileged background.
The sport was only played by a privileged few.
comfortably off
having enough money to have a nice life without having to worry about money
I wouldn’t say that we were rich – just comfortably off.
be rolling in it/be loaded
to be extremely rich
They’ve got two houses and a boat – they must be rolling in it.
Her books were so successful that she’s loaded now.
